thread.title: Hailo says demand for app up 25pc during train strike
thread.title_full: Hailo says demand for app up 25pc during train strike

title: Hailo says demand for app up 25pc during train strike
text:
Hailo says demand for app up 25pc during train strike 
Independent.ie Friday 23rd October, 2015 
TAXI app Hailo said today that demand for its app was up 25pc this morning during the Irish Rail train strike. 
It added that peak demand was between 8am and 9am as the app helped commuters scrambling for alternative transport options. 
Hailo offered a 20pc discount to passengers who made their journeys before 7am or after 10am. 
Tim Arnold, Hailo's General Manager in Ireland, said: "Our off-peak hours incentive worked well, hundreds of passengers took our advice and travelled before the rush hour. "So, our drivers got more jobs, customers got taxis faster, and demand was spread acros...
